2. `make distclean`
3. `make` without any options and local.mk

comment_data.body: Can you bisect the failure? (And make sure to `git clean -fdx` to make absolutely sure you don't have stale build files; if you use `ccache` or `sccache`, wipe those too.)

Relevant commit is in fact https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/ae9674704ac5586438f60c883e918d448ef0e237
So please check your environment variables. Are you calling make in a naked terminal, or within tmux or Neovim terminal or similar?

> nvim: Failed to --listen: "no such file or directory"

Is something in your environment setting NVIM_APPNAME or NVIM_LISTEN_ADDRESS? https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/30256

> Is something in your environment setting NVIM_APPNAME or NVIM_LISTEN_ADDRESS? #30256

If this turns out to be the case maybe we could just unset these in the cmake file?

# My environments

* in naked terminal directly(Alacritty on Windows)
* no ccache, no sccache
* I don't set $NVIM_APPNAME or $NVIM_LISTEN_ADDRESS.

```console
$ echo $NVIM_APPNAME $NVIM_LISTEN_ADDRESS # nothing displayed

```

# after git clean -fdx

run `make distclean`, `git clean -fdx` and `make` again, but build failed same.

```console
$ make distclean
#...
$ git clean -fdx
$ make
```
